overview_of_class: The primary goal of this course is to explore theory and research on attraction and close relationships. Expectations for participants are high: They will be expected (a) to read all readings carefully prior to attending each class session, (b) to participate actively in class discussion, (c) to give a formal (conference-like) presentation, and (d) to write two formal research proposals. By the end of the course, students should be knowledgeable about research on attraction and close relationships and capable of generating original research on the topic.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisites: A graduate-level social psychology course or the permission of the instructor.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: The weekly class meetings will consist of faculty lectures, seminar-type class discussion, and formal student presentations.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Students will be evaluated on the quality of their (a) general class participation, (b) formal research proposals, and (c) formal (conference-like) presentation.
